comment: I really enjoyed Kerfoot's class, he gave us a lot of leeway in choosing our essay subjects. He does not give you a lot of time between getting your sources and writing the paper so I suggest writing the paper as you do the Source Responses. Do not skip class, it won't be worth it. One of the best English classes I have taken.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: His class was super fun to take! He's a tough grader on essays, but in the end you will be grateful for the feedback he gives. He also allows revisions on each essay so you have a chance to fix your grade. He made essay topics fun and interesting!
Looooved Kerfoot, definitely an oddball but he's so cool. I think he's leaving KSU next year which is sad but if anyone has the chance to take him in the future would definitely recommend!

Kerfoot is such a funny and creative character. His essays are fairly strange, but they are fun to write nonetheless. Would totally recommend; even if you are not the best at writing essays, he will totally help you out. Gives extra credit for attendance.
The best English class I have had to date. The man is absolutely hilarious and the class was easy yet informative
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: Professor Kerfoot is a great professor. He makes you work for your grade. If you recieve a grade you do not like on a paper he allows revisions which help your grade immensely. I would recommend for anyone to take him, and go to class because he adds 3 points to your final grade if you have perfect attendence.

Excellent professor. Prof. Kerfoot cares immensely about the success of students willing to work hard. His grading of essays may be fairly harsh, however he makes up for this for allowing revisions for full credit to be turned in 2 weeks after the due date. He is also hilarious and has a good teaching style.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--Hilarious

comment: Kerfoot has interesting essay topics and is willing to answer any questions you have. Would recommend to anyone who is tired of writing boring essays.

One of the most amazing professors I have ever had, and can honestly be compared to Robin Williams' character in Dead Poets Society. You basically get to pick your own topic for each paper, and he allows for rewrites. You do have to get the book for weekly reading responses. A really caring and sweet guy that makes class fun and interesting :)

Kerfoot has been one of my favorite professors of all of KSU. Even though I hate writing papers, the Disney related topics he gives us makes it less tragic. However, he is a tough grader, but he allows corrections for a few extra points. 1102, 4 essays, 1 final project.

I had professor kerfoot for English and he is honestly one of my favorite professors Ive had! His class is super fun and you write about interesting topics. This semester we wrote about monsters and he made is extremely interesting. His only downside is you really have to work for your grade because he is a very tough grader. Regardless loved him!

Great professor as he is nice and funny. He's a tough grader and it's hard to get an A in his class unless you go the extra mile. If you do everything he asks for you'll only get a B. There's several essays throughout the semester & you have to read from the textbook & write about it the next day. If you're not good at writing, I don't recommend.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: He's a great professor! He makes his courses interesting and helps you understand what writing tool you're trying to work on in each paper. 1101 we wrote about monsters and 1102 was about Disney, which to say the least was memorable. I would definitely take him for your classes.
Great teacher! Funny, attractive, interesting. Will make you work for the grade you want but once you know what's expected it's not hard.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Kerfoot is a funny teacher and nice guy, but his tests are impossible and he doesn't curve.  He gives attendance quizzes every week so don't ever skip class haha.  I have read all books and studied for every test for several days, but still can only manage a C.  I'm frustrated.
takes attendance with points off for no show.  You have an incredible number of books to read with hard tests.  Pop quizzes are a killer.  Do Not take him!.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Very funny, just read the books and participate in the discussion and you'll pass.

Kerfoot is truly one of Kennesaw's  best professors. I took his 1102 class which was Disney based and I did not regret anything. There are 4 essays and 1 final project, no tests. The rubrics are pretty cut clear. If you do what is written you will receive a B in his class, go above and beyond to receive an A. I would definitely take again.

He is my favorite professor at Kennesaw State. His grading material is extremely clear. He sets his students up to get a B in the class. He is more than willing to help his students. Do the essay corrections; they help with the grade 5-10 points. Kerfoot is funny and has student involvement. The best English teacher I have had. Makes learning fun!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--Clear grading criteria

comment: Very good professor. Cares about students and the work is pretty easy. You have to put in a little effort. I will say it's much easier to get a good grade if you're a natural at writing, but still easy and lots of room to make up for one or two slip ups.

Kerfoot was a great professor. His essays were not boring and he would help outline how he wanted the essays to flow. You essentially are at a B when he grades each essay and he adds or deducts points depending on you following directions or not. He allows for corrections which he doesn't grade until the end of the semester.
rating_tags: Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.--Amazing lectures

comment: Kerfoot is easily the best prof i've had at KSU. I took his 1102 which is Disney themed. 4 papers and a final. Tough grader but gives you plenty of opportunity to improve your grade. Hilarious guy! TAKE THIS CLASS. you will not be dissapointed

He's a young professor, so he's easy to get along with. I had English 1102, and the class is based off Disney movies. However, your essays can be about other movies that aren't Disney. He's a tought grader, but he let's you do revisions. Make sure you show up for class because you'll drop a letter grade after 3 absences.

Even though he is a tough grader his instructions and rubrics are every clear cut and if you follow the guidelines and put in effort you will definitely make a B and possibly an A. Kerfoot makes class entertaining and interesting. He's funny, young and relatable. However if you do not enjoy Disney do not take the class- it's in every essay topic.

Had him for Comp 1 and 2. Great teacher! Very easy going and cool but don't disrespect him. Can be really nice or really tough. Follow his rubrics exactly, listen in class, & pay attention. Not as hard as people say he is. He's helpful but you have to bug him to get an email back. Take the Friday once a week class!  Final project is interesting!
Excellent teacher, would definitely take again. one great thing that he does is revision. All you have to do is follow his directions and you will definitely make a B.....10724

Kerfoot was the best teacher ever. The class was focused on Disney, so that was fun. There are 4 essays and 1 project for the final. Read because he does reading responses! He is a tough grader, but his rubrics are very clear about what he wants in essays. As long as you do what you need to do, and try to go above and beyond, you will do fine!
He is great! The papers are very specific and kind of hard but he is super open to questions and fairly quick with emails. Be sure to come to class and you will get the information you need.

He has 4 papers and and a final project. They start off very clear specific and then he slowly gives less direction to the whole class but he is happy to give you individual attention. He makes you do journals where you write for completion and there are quizzes on the textbook but it's open ended to have you write whatever to prove you read.

Professor Kerfoot is the man. He's extremely knowledgeable on writing and will make you a better writer. The way he does this is through rigorous, but fair grading. If you aren't ready to put some work in and improve dont take his class.

There are a lot of essays and assignments that with them. If you miss a class then you will fall behind.I tried asking him for help and instead of answering my question he would just ask me questions and leave me even more confused than I was before. If you don't like Disney then do not take him,I learned more about disney in his class than English

He was super helpful and he made everything super clear. If you follow directions you'll get a B on every paper, even if it's not a great paper. In class he's hilarious (mostly in a sarcastic way) and gets people interested. I always looked forward to going to class even though it was a morning class. You will have to do a lot of homework though

He is a tough grader, but he gives wonderful feedback and it willing to help.  He makes you work for an A, this is not an "easy A", so if you are looking for an "easy A" don't take Kerfoot. Cass is so much fun, it is worth the extra work.  Must show up to class, extra credit points at the end with perfect attendance. Must have Writing Argument book
He doesn't grade based off of your ability to write. The students who try the hardest on the essays get the higher grades. It's an easy B if you do all your work. You will have to work for an A

You have to work hard if you want to pass his class. His main point being that in order for you to get a good grade, try your best on his essays and he will help you. He doesn't take foolishness, just as long as you put in the effort He cares about his students, and don't make excuses as to why you didn't show up for his class, unless it is legit.

He's honestly one of the best teacher's I've had. Follow the directions for each essay and your bound to pass. He allows revisions, which are key. TAKE ADVANTAGE OF REVISIONS, you will thank yourself in the long run!  He even leaves comments on what you can improve in order to get a better grade. Adore him!
Funny AF

He's the toughest grader I have ever experienced. If you don't put effort into your essays you will not pass. He's a good teacher and will tell you the things that you are doing wrong, but he will often expect too much of you. All in all, I learned a whole lot and recommend him to those who are willing to work or to those who are English majors.

By far one of the best teachers I have ever had.  He is an extremely tough grader but if you work hard you will do well. He makes class fun and I honestly looked forward to classes. I would highly recommend him.

He is a VERY harsh grader, says he won't give many A's on essays up front. Even if you follow his specific guidelines he gives a ton of C's. His class is not necessarily hard, but it is SO time consuming. You will have essay after essay, each with many assignments leading up to them. I would recommend someone else if you have the option.

He is a great professor. I took him a few years ago and loved his class. I got an A because I am a good writer. If you're not, well, pick another professor. He is a stickler for writing and if you are average, you will not get over a C in the class.

I took this professor class for 1101 and stupidly signed up for his class again with the thought that since I already knew how he was, it would be easier. I was wrong, he was still just as brutal with his grading. This class is for people who enjoy working really hard on assignments and receiving a B at the highest. Good luck if you take it!

This is one amazing class! Lots of fun and Professor Kerfoot is one of the best professors i have had. The class environment is very light hearted and friendly. He is a hard grader but as long as you put in the work and actually try hard on your papers then you will do fine. reading is required for quizzes and make sure you do your journals.

Professor Kerfoot was one of the best professors I've ever had. Yes, at first he is a tough grader he does not give A+, but if you show up to class and listen to what he has to say then you will succeed. He loves monsters and focuses on them so it is always interesting. Journals are a must. I recommend him. You only get 3 absences.

Started out rough, but the guy really is a phenomenal teacher. Despite tearing my papers apart and at times making me feel like I'd never get a good grade on assignments, he really taught me a lot about writing and I feel much better going into the next semester. He's an A+ teacher.

Kerfoot was an awesome professor, and I am taking him again next semester. Tough grader on papers but made me a better writer. Gives you a chance to re-do papers as well for a better grade. 4 essays and a final project, quizzes over the book every once and a while, and journal entries. Funny guy, just asks you put effort into every assignment.
Not too much work, he provides excellent feedback and allows you to resubmit assignments for a chance at a better grade.

This is the best professor in the world. He's young and attractive so your attendance will be perfect. Everyone loves him because he makes his class fun and is a fair grader. There are no tests and only 4 papers. You can do a revision on every paper and still get full credit. Final is a very simple and fun project. GET THIS PROFESSOR, TRUST ME!

The class was great! The quizzes weren't too bad if you just made sure you read the chapter. The papers are okay as long as you can follow directions. (basically if you just follow his rubric you'll get a B on the paper no problem.) It's SO much fun, the paper topics are awesome and he's hilarious!

His class was great. He is a cool guy and very understanding. He will joke around with you as long as you do your work. Class isn't completely mandatory but if you miss more than 3 classes you will drop a letter grade. He grades tough but he is very clear with the directions and as long as you follow them you should do fine. Do your peer reviews!

Kerfoot's class is NOT easy. Essay after essay. You can definitely pass it if writing comes easily to you. Only like 7 simple quizzes a semester but you will not pass them if you don't read the chapter. Journal entries that are lengthy but you get a 100 if you do it. He's really helpful but a HARD GRADER

I didn't get the desired grade  but Kerfoot is a pretty good prof. He takes his job seriously and grades accordingly. His obsession with Frozen is annoying but he makes his paper topics fun and is always willing to help you. Overall my personal experiences have left me with some salty feelings with the class but he is not a bad prof by any means.

Top notch professor! You get a redo for every paper and he is a very harsh grader! Papers were all Disney themed and related and he is really hot! Attendance is mandatory and perfect attendance get you percentage points on final average! Sweet and approachable and definitely willing to sit down, talk, and help you out. Have a problem email him!

Prof Kerfoot is one of the best professors I have ever had. He does not hand out free grades but as long as you put in a little effort you will be fine. He gives you every opportunity to succeed including one redo per graded paper. His goal in this class is to teach you to write and he assigns the most interesting topics for papers hands down.
he's a harsh grader

Kerfoot is by far one of the best professors you could ask for. He is passionate about English and will strive to make you just as enthusiastic for his class.. (all of our essays were Disney themed). Most fun class all semester with a tremendously clear and concise style of learning.
He's nice but he grades hard. I went to the writing center before every paper was due and I still never made an A on one. The final paper was hard and it was graded hard too!
Worst professor I have ever had in my entire life. He has extremely unrealistic expectations when it comes to grading.

Good professor. gives very clear guidelines, however is an extremely harsh grader. If you take him, I would recommend going to the writing lab for every paper! Otherwise not very hard, easy to make a B.
He helped me out with my grade a lot because i am really bad at writing. He works with you and gives you extra points as much as possible

Wonderful teacher, really cares about his students. Will help as much as possible if you ask. Essays follow rubrics given and textbooks are mandatory. Very fair and laid back, I look forward to going to this class.

Class is very easy to get a B. Most classes were fun and entertaining and I really wish I could take it again even though English is one of my least favorite subjects. He tells you literally how to write your paper so if you do MLA and follow his rubric/guidelines, you will at least get a B, only 2-3 got A's on each paper we wrote in class.

Amazing professor. Easy if you're a quality writer. If you're not a good writer, do not take his course. His corrections aren't very helpful, and you won't improve much as far as your grade is concerned.

Professor Kerfoot is one of the best professors I've had at Kennesaw. He is extremely laid back but super helpful.  No textbook use at all. He also lets you redo every paper. I would highly suggest taking his class.

A very enthusiastic professor. He is young and rather laid-back, but does know his stuff. His grading system and rubric are straight-forward enough, so as long as you follow them and do your best, you'll do great. He is fair and helpful and entertaining at times! I really enjoyed his class and will miss it next semester.

Kerfoot is pretty much the coolest teacher you'll ever get. What he expects on his papers is clear in the rubric. Homework is on twitter (awesome and easy) and you have journals the first part of the semester. (writing 5 paper a week about anything you want) all papers are on fun topics. Take Him!!
Great professor! I loved this class. We wrote about really interesting and current topics. Very laid back, but really cares about your success. TAKE HIM!!!

AWESOME teacher! completely relatable, fair with grading, little assignments for easy 100's,makes class fun. take him if you can! i never liked english until this year becasue he makes it so easy to understand! best professor ever! (:

He is a very good professor and really cares about his students. Very laid back and will help you succeed if you ask for help. Textbook was used more for reference. I would very highly recommend taking his course as he is not overly demanding with his grades.
Great professor!  He takes a boring subject and makes it interesting.  Follow his rubrics and you'll make a good grade.  Definitely take if you have the option.
Geat teacher!! His essays strictly follow the rubric, so if you follow it, you should do well. The classes are never boring. If you get the chance to take his class, definitely take it!

He grades strictly with the rubric but knows what he's talking about. He's very helpful and his classes are always fun. He gives plenty of time for papers and uses different kinds of media in class. Textbooks are mandatory. Get him if you can! He's young but he's a really good professor.

He's actually pretty cool! He takes boring material and makes it pretty fun. The essay topics we have are pretty straightforward and interesting to write about. Personally, I don't like the way he grades papers but other than that, he's a pretty awesome.

Probably the coolest professor I'll ever have. He keeps his class lighthearted and fun by being one of the kids. The essays were few but a lot was expected of each. I was pretty upset when I missed his class a grand total of one time. When choosing an English class, make sure you get this guy because you will not regret it
